ISceneObject Interface Reference
[SCENE+ Module]

import "sceneplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for ISceneObject:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

SCENE+ Meshed Object.

The Scene Meshed Object ties together a (part of) kinematical system (skeleton of bones) with one or more meshes spread on it, providing the essential functionality to render the meshed, multi-boned objects.

To be functional the Scene Meshed Objects must obtain a pointer to the Renderer Object (IRndrGeneric) - see ISceneObject::PutRenderer and How to Configure a Scene of Animation. Supplying the IMeshDictionary is not required, as typically the objects are capable to create a dictionary automatically. The IsReady function (inherited from ISceneRenderee) tests if the Renderer is known.

Being an IKineNode derivative, a Scene Meshed Object is in fact the root bone of its own kinematical system. Use the IKineNode functions, eg. IKineNode::AddChild to build-up the object's bone skeleton.

Special purpose functions, NewMesh and AddMesh, create and add the meshes (IMesh objects). You can also add the meshes as conventional child nodes but doing so is highly unrecommended due to obligatory mesh initialisation.

To render the Scene Meshed Object, just call the Render function inherited after ISceneRenderee.

See also:
FreeWillPlus::SceneObject implementation class.

 Retrieves the material object previously set with PutMaterial, or NULL if none.

Mesh Facility Functions
Even if meshes are added to the kinematical system as child nodes, it is highly recommended to use these functions instead of IKineNode::AddChild to provide mandatory initialisation for the mesh objects

HRESULT NewMesh (FWSTRING pLabel,[out, retval] IMesh **)
 Creates a new Mesh and calls AddMesh; uses IFWDevice::CreateObject to create a standard Mesh object.

HRESULT AddMesh (FWSTRING pLabel, IMesh *)
 Adds the given mesh to the internal list of meshes and initialises it by passing the appropriate objects to IMesh::PutBuffers, and IMesh::PutDictionary.

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT ISceneObject::PutMaterial (  IMaterial *  ,
BOOL  bOverwrite
) 
 

Puts the default material for the object's meshes (more...).

Setting a new material affects all existing meshes as well as new meshes added with NewMesh or AddMesh. If bOverwrite is set to TRUE, the material will be overwritten for every mesh. If it is FALSE, meshes that have their own material set by IMesh::SetMaterial will remain unaffected.
